result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney Rae Nissenbaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber release to the Day Reporting Center and for inmate work assigments only.  The Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Referral to the Mental Health Unit.
The Court instructs DOC to develop a trauma informed care plan for the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs by the end of probation period, any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment. Bail to apply.
Seek/maintain full time work or full time school or full time AODA trearment, or any combination equal to 40 hours.
Obtain mental health evaluation.  Cooperate with recommended follow up care/treatment.
No possession/use of alcohol or any controlled substances unless valid prescription and follow prescription instructions.
Fill prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent and notify DOC agent of the pharmacy.

Obtain AODA assessment. Cooperate with recommended follow up care/treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct random urine screens/alcohol testing at least once per month during the entire two (2) years of probation.

timeConds.notes:
01-25-16/ Judge Carolina Stark
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant shall serve the 4 months of the condition time that was imposed and stayed.  The Condition time shall be served at the Milwaukee HOC, without good time credit, and the Court continues to have a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  The defendant is granted release privileges only for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments, if she is eligible.  If the defendant is not already in custody at the HOC, a commitment order shall be issued immediately directing the Milwaukee County Sheriff to take the defendant into custody to serve the condition time at the HOC. 

Release to the Day Reporting Center and for inmate work assignments only.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  Condition time to be imposed if defendant violates any of the following conditions:  Missed  drug test.  Failure to provide usable sample.  Positive drug tests.  Possess controlled substances without valid prescription.  Possess drug paraphernalia.   Failure to comply with AODA treatment plan.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 12-09-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Courtney Rae Nissenbaum in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case  for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 12-10-2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
